name: 'Corpse Bride' I Quiz | Corpse Bride . | 10 Questions

questions.text: The story of 'Tim Burton's Corpse Bride' centers around a diffident young man named Victor, who is being involved in an arranged marriage.  Which Tim Burton regular provides the voice for young Victor?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Depp.

	Prior to 'Corpse Bride', Johnny Depp had starred in four other films directed by Tim Burton, namely: 'Edward Scissorhands', 'Ed Wood', 'Sleepy Hollow' and 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'.

questions.text: During the opening credits of the film, what creature does Victor draw on a piece of paper?
questions.explanation:
Butterfly.

	Though Tim Burton is known for his delight in the macabre, he never hesitates to be inclusive of some beauty in his films.  The butterfly is a foreshadowing of the ending.

questions.text: Victor's mother and father, Nell and William Van Dort, are very pleased by the fact that their son will soon be married.
questions.explanation:
True.

	While the Van Dort's celebrate the 'beautiful day' that is to come, the parents of Victoria, Victor's fiancée, are rather displeased.

questions.text: Which comedy actress is responsible not only for the voice of Victor's mother Nell, but also for the servant Hildegarde?
questions.explanation:
Tracey Ullman.

	Tracey Ullman is an absolute master of disguising her voice, so playing two different speaking roles is piece of cake for her.  Surprisingly, this is the first time she and Tim Burton have worked together.

questions.text: Lord and Lady Everglot, parents of the bride-to-be, Victoria, are members of the landed aristocracy without a penny to their names.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Indeed, while the Van Dorts are considered to be nouveau riche by the Everglots, the Everglots themselves are bankrupt.  Thus, the arrangement has been made for their dowry-less daughter to be married to the wealthy young Victor.

questions.text: The very grim Lord Everglot is voiced by which distinguished actor?
questions.explanation:
Albert Finney.

	Albert Finney worked with Tim Burton once before on the 2003 film 'Big Fish'.  His deep, gruff voice is very fitting for Lord Everglot.

questions.text: When Victoria first encounters Victor alone in her mansion, what is Victor doing?
questions.explanation:
Playing the piano.

	On the piano, Victor plays the beautiful theme melody of the film, composed by Danny Elfman.  Victor is interrupted by Victoria, who has become curious about the lovely music she hears while fixing her hair in her room.

questions.text: The object of the Van Dort's visit to the Everglot home is to rehearse the elaborate wedding ceremony that the two young people must perform.  Which often sinister character actor plays the voice of Pastor Galswells, who will preside over the wedding ceremony?
questions.explanation:
Christopher Lee.

	Christopher Lee, who has thrilled modern audiences with his performances in the second 'Star Wars' trilogy and the 'Lord of the Rings' trilogy, generously provides his voice for this film.  He previously worked with Tim Burton on the movie 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'.

questions.text: During the wedding rehearsal, Victoria is repeatedly unable to follow the instructions of Pastor Galswells.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Rather, it is the hapless Victor who either cannot remember the sequence of words he must repeat or is unable to light the candle that has been provided to him.  Poor Victor is simply too nervous to proceed.

questions.text: What is the name of the nefarious 'nobleman' who appears at the wedding rehearsal?
questions.explanation:
Lord Barkis.

	Lord Barkis Bittern is his full name.  His voice is marvelous done by Richard E. Grant, who you may recognize from such films as 'Withnail and I', 'L.A. Story', 'Gosford Park' and 'Bright Young Things'. Thank you for trying this quiz.  I welcome you to try its sequels.
